An introduction to ggplot

R • ggplot • data visualization • tutorial
By Kodi Weatherholtz August 01, 2015 Comment Tweet Like +1

ggplot2 is my go-to tool in R for producing complex publication-quality graphics. Several years ago, I developed a tutorial that provides a basic introduction to ggplot2, along with an overview of more advanced functionality for researchers dealing with language data. Here are the slides (for posterity!). These slides were produced in RStudio using knitr.

  • tutorial: slide show
  • data sets: (1) Peterson and Barney (1952) vowels; (2) fakedata.txt; (3) fakedata_geo.txt
  • .zip file: R code and data sets
